title: Hook Hampshire Walks

images.title: Andrew Smith / Farmland, Hook
images.caption: Farmland, Hook Pasture and a maize crop just above the River Whitewater. A footpath descending from Totters Farm is slightly to the south. There is just a glimpse of Hook's plentiful modern housing.

images.title: River Whitewater by don cload, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: River Whitewater

images.title: Andrew Smith / Meadows, Hook
images.caption: Meadows, Hook. The River Whitewater is unseen in the foreground. On the other side is a Hampshire Wildlife Trust nature reserve consisting of meadow and reed-bed.

images.title: The Crooked Billet, Hook by David Howard, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Crooked Billet, Hook

description: This Hampshire based town has some nice local woods, river walks, a pleasant local nature reserve and a number of nearby country parks to explore. This short walk in the town visits the Bassets Mead park. The small park is located on the eastern side of the town and consists of some pleasant footpaths along the River Whitewater. There are three car parks at the site providing access to the easy footpaths. On the site there's meadows, ponds and copse with information boards telling you all about the flora and fauna you can see here. You can extend the walk by heading north to visit the adjacent Whitewater Meadows.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Crooked Billet is located right next to the park. The waterside pub can be found at London Roadd, RG27 9EH.

display_address: London Road, Hook, Hart, Hampshire, England, RG27 9EH, United Kingdom
